name: Simulink-Sp15
tagline: CSE Training Workshops in Engineering Software
body: ## A Short Course for Engineers ##### April 20, 22, 27, 29 (Mon/Wed) • 1–3 p.m. • MEL 1001 MathWorks Simulink is the premier high-powered graphical programming language for modeling and simulating dynamic systems across many domains. This short course is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of the interface and modeling through engineering exercises and physical models. This course will be offered in April 2015 by [Computational Science and Engineering](http://cse.illinois.edu/) for a fee of $200, intended to recover costs of course development and delivery. ### Topics 1. Introduction to Simulink - Control Systems Refresher - Interface & workflow - Block diagrams 2. Continuous Systems - Comparison & decision states - Zero crossings - MATLAB functions - Subsystems 3. Discrete Systems 4. Intermediate Topics - Debugging - Libraries - Large Models
